SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: Determination of characteristic signs for the early diagnosis of neuro-otological complications of otitis media
SETTING: University Hospital Groningen, the Netherlands
METHOD: The medical histories of 11 patients with neuro-otological complications of otitis media were analysed
The time interval between the first manifestation of symptoms related to the complication and the start of correct therapy was established
RESULTS: In 10 of the 11 patients persistent fever and (or) headache were manifest as early symptoms
More severe morbidity was correlated with an increased time interval between the early symptoms and the start of treatment
Doctor's delay was regarded as the most significant delaying factor
CONCLUSION: Early diagnosis of neuro-otological complications of otitis media based on the early symptoms persistent fever and headache can reduce morbidity and mortality
